page.title: 04Wem Carnival
page.content: Long ago, people used to have carnivals as a form of entertainment. Wem Carnival began in 1927, and went on to 1956. It was revived in 1981. As well as a form of entertainment, Wem Carnival is also a fund raising event. The money raised goes to local organisations. The carnival is run by a committee of twelve local people. The procession includes floats,dancing troupes and different types of bands-people dressed up in bright clothing. This year between 3 and 4 thousand people will take part with 70 floats, 52 dancing troupes and a Carnival Queen all led by Wem Band. This year the Carnival is on September 7th-11th. The procession starts at 2 o'clock on the last day and takes about an hour and a half to pass through the town centre. It repeats the route at 7.30 that night.
